data: A structured lexical resource based on WordNet, which assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains about 5,000 short phrases, collected from financial news and press releases by Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each short phrase is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for sentiment understanding in financial texts, which combines artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process concepts in this domain.

It provides entity-sentiment annotation to address the problem of news headlines containing multiple entities that may have conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, consisting of over 10,700 news headlines, provides insight into entity-specific sentiment variations in financial news.

A tokenized and annotated dataset derived from the speeches, minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relations in financial documents with about 29,000 instances and 22 relation types between eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, org-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. It is useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Collected from various news sources and human-evaluated by experts, allowing researchers to discover how news headlines impact price volatility, asset correlation, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, which helps identify financial entities and categorize them in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answers with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it relies on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
